Description: Scarab in glazed composition, probably mould-made; underside decorated with a very debased hieroglyphic inscription.
Curator's comments: Scarab not yet located, published by Petrie (Petrie 1886, pl. XXXVII, no. 108). It seems to have the motto "Respectability and strength" (imAx is legible, but not wsr), though the hieroglyphs are so debased that it is almost impossible to recognise the signs. For a proper version of that motto, see a scarab discovered in Cerveteri (Hölbl 1979, 31, pl. 72/1, no. 102). Hölbl, G. 1979, Beziehungen der ägyptischen Kultur zu Altitalien (EPRO 62/I), Leiden. Petrie, W.M.F. 1886, Naukratis. Part I, 1884–5 (Third Memoir of the Egypt Exploration Fund), London.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXVII, no. 108)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (OC.131) (phase 3)
